intro: Sisymbrium pumilum, commonly known as dwarf cabbage, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, featuring small, rounded leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous species like cabbage and mustard. Its seeds are small and can be dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution. Sisymbrium pumilum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including fields and roadsides.
